item.name: Attributes
item.description: Supports CRUD operations for managing attributes. These endpoints generally require an attribute `target` to be specified to ensure appropriate separation and assignment of attributes to the correct target - `Item` or `Category`.

description.content:
In fabric **Products**, both products (Items, Variants, and Bundles) and categories have attributes. For products, they may be technical specifications like size, weight, etc., design specifications like color, material, etc. For Categories, they may be basic specifications such as name, description, ID, etc.

This endpoint creates attributes that can be assigned to a `target` - Product or Category.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: User is not allowed to perform the action

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

Once attributes are created, this endpoint gets all the available attributes that can be assigned to the requested `target` - `item` or `category`. You can refine search results by specifying `offset` and `limit`. When they are not specified, by default, you'll get up to 10 attributes.
Comma-separated locale codes of product. You'll get 400 error if locale/locales are not supported. Refer to standard locales in https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc5646.
Maximum number of records per page
Number of records to skip before returning records. For example, `offset=20, limit=10` returns records 21-30.
Distinguishes between `Product` and `Category` attributes

response.name: OK

E-commerce platforms (web or app) show product details based on attributes such as name, size, color, and other specifications.

This endpoint gets the details of a particular attribute by its ID, which is used to display on the e-commerce platform.

(Required) 24-character system-generated attribute ID

Over time, fabric **Products** may accumulate attributes that are no longer relevant or were created with incorrect or incomplete information. This can cause downstream issues.

This endpoint provides the flexibility to delete an attribute by its ID, without impacting other attributes

**Note**: An attribute cannot be deleted if it's already assigned to `Item` or `Category`.
(Required) 24-character system-generated attribute ID
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Attribute Groups
item.description: Attribute Group is a collection of product attributes that helps categorize products into various semantic groups based on meaning and purpose, allowing for easier management and organization of products in the catalog. Supports CRUD operations for managing attribute groups.

description.content:
Attribute group is a collection of attributes that can be assigned to products or categories.

This endpoint creates an attribute group with associated attributes so that it's easier to assign attributes to products and categories

**Note**: At least one attribute must be specified.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

When launching a new product line, it may be necessary to update certain aspects, such as adding or deleting attributes, updating attribute group name, or adjusting the sequence in which they appear on UI.

This endpoint is used to group attributes and mark them as editable or read-only. In addition, you can update the details of attribute groups such as name, description, priority order, and more. This endpoint completely replaces the existing details.
(Required) 24-character system-generated attribute group ID

item.name: Attributes Mapping
item.description: fabric has a predefined set of mandatory attributes for `Items` and `Categories`. However, as merchants, you may have your own naming conventions for these attributes. For instance, a mandatory attribute 'unique item identifier' may be referred to as `SKU` by fabric and as `productId` by merchant. To address this inconsistency, merchant-defined attributes are mapped to fabric attributes as productId -> fabric SKU. These endpoints are used to get and update mapping of attributes.

description.content: Before adding an item (with or without variants) to fabric **Products**, you must map merchant-specific attributes to fabric-specific attributes. Once mapping is created, this endpoint is used to get the mapping details.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: User is not allowed to perform the action

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
This endpoint updates mapping of merchant-defined attributes to fabric-defined standard attributes. This will help ensure consistency.
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: User is not allowed to perform the action

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

fabric **Products** supports two types of attributes: Item Attributes and Category Attributes. Within fabric Products, a product could be an item, a variant, or a bundle. Product attributes are factual and objective descriptions that shoppers see when browsing through an e-commerce platform (website or mobile app). These attributes may include technical specifications such as size and weight, design specifications such as color and material, as well as basic details like name, description, and ID. Similarly, Category attributes define the characteristics of parent and children categories. They are essential for organizing products in logical groups, making it easier for shoppers to browse and find products on your platform with minimal cognitive load.
